Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2012 04:11PM PamCA wrote: Hello, I am starting my chemo tomorrow morning.  So I am nervous, scared, etc.  I have Stage IIA.  Had a  lumpectomy - one lump and 6 lymph nodes removed in mid February.  Last Monday had port put in my left chest.  It was much more painful than dr. said, but have taken hydrocodin until about a day ago.  Just sore now.  I am having 4 treatments of Taxotere/Cytoxan - each 3 weeks apart.    I am wondering - does anyone know if the side effects are less severe if you have the chemo every 3 weeks versus having them closer together?   And is the Neuglasta (sp?) used only with certain types of chemo or with all the chemo drugs?  I am really glad I found this place.

Posts.Content: PamCA wrote: Hello everyone, I am hoping someone can  help me.  I had my last chemo trmt on June 5.  I started rads on June 18.  But I have been noticing in last couple of weeks that my eyebrows are getting more and more sparse to the point where I hardly have any!  It seems to me that they should quit falling out since I am not doing chemo any more. Does anyone else have an experience like this?  thanks.  Pam  Dx 2/9/2012, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, 3/6 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: PamCA wrote: Hi, I am wondering if the side effects are less severe if there is a longer amount of time between treatments?  I have Stage IIA and am starting Taxotere/Cytoxan tomorrow and will be having 3 weeks between each treatment.    Can someone who has done their chemo every 3 weeks tell me what their side effects were like so I'll have a better idea of what to expect?  When I was reading some of the posts with side effects described, I was getting kind of freaked out, but then I realized I didn't know how frequently their chemo treatments were given and if that made a difference. Thanks for helping.  Dx 2/9/2012, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, 3/6 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 06:07PM PamCA wrote: Hi - I was just wondering if you are able to eat solid food with your diarrhea?  Mine started on April 7 and is still going on as of today - April 11.  Had it so bad over this past weekend that I had to get a liter of IV fluids on Monday at dr.  She gave me some Lomotil for diarrhea and stomach cramps.  It lessens the cramps a lot, but still have diarrhea a couple of times a day.  If I eat anything other than soup, jello, etc. the cramps get worse.  How long did the diarrhea last for you?  This is from my first chemo treatment too so don't know what to expect.  Any advice appreciated.  Thanks.  Pam
